lesson_html:
• Hello! - A common way to greet someone.
  • How are you? - A friendly way to ask about someone's well-being.
  • Good morning! - Used in the morning until around noon.
  • Good afternoon! - Used from noon until around 6 PM.
  • Good evening! - Used after 6 PM to greet someone.

items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's recent state.
This question inquires about someone's activities from the previous day.

items.en: Are you enjoying your time here?
items.explanation_en: This question asks if someone is having a good time.

items.en: Do you have any plans for the weekend?
items.target: ¿Tienes planes para el fin de semana?
items.explanation_en: This question is about someone's upcoming weekend activities.

items.en: It's been a while since we last met.
items.target: Ha pasado un tiempo desde que nos vimos por última vez.
items.explanation_en: This statement reflects on the time since the last meeting.

items.en: I hope you are doing well.
items.explanation_en: This expresses a wish for someone's well-being.

items.en: What time do you usually wake up?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's waking habits.

items.en: Have you seen any good movies lately?
items.explanation_en: This question inquires about recent movie experiences.

items.en: Are you ready for the meeting?
items.explanation_en: This question checks someone's readiness for an upcoming meeting.

items.en: What do you like to do in your free time?
items.target: ¿Qué te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's leisure activities.
